title: Thousands of Afghans in U.S. Get Deportation Protections
sub_head: A small group of Afghans would benefit most from Temporary Protected Status, which lets them stay in the U.S. and work legally for 18 months
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Biden administration is offering a form of temporary humanitarian protection to thousands of Afghans living in the U.S. without a permanent legal status, the Department of Homeland Security said Wednesday.
Any Afghan present in the U.S. on or before March 15 would be eligible for the protection, known as temporary protected status or TPS, which shields them from deportation and allows them to work legally for 18 months, a term that can be renewed.
